arm_group.description: After discharge, patients participate in daily physical therapy for 3 weeks in a rehabilitation hospital.
After discharge, patients participate in daily physical therapy for 3 weeks in an outpatient rehabilitation center.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare inpatient and outpatient rehabilitation following
      total knee arthroplasty.  Outpatient rehabilitation should be provided at the same level of
      quality as inpatient care. Thus, it is assumed that outpatient rehabilitation is
      non-inferior to the inpatient standard-of-care therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Inpatient Versus Outpatient Rehabilitation After TKA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with knee osteoarthritis and scheduled for primary TKA

          -  age: 70-85

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  BMI > 40

          -  musculoskeletal and neurological disorders that limit physical function

          -  any planned further joint surgery within 6 months

          -  substantial pain or functional limitation which make the patients unable to perform
             study procedures
